# OpenHack MDWH - Azure Synapse Analytics Demo

## Challenge 4 - More than meets the eye - Streaming Data

#### Project URL
- <https://github.com/aessing/demo-azuresynapse>

#### Developer
Andre Essing
- <https://www.andre-essing.de/>
- <https://github.com/aessing>
- <https://twitter.com/aessing>
- <https://www.linkedin.com/in/aessing/>

> THIS CODE AND INFORMATION ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND/OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

from pyspark.sql.types import StringType, TimestampType, DateType, IntegerType, StructType
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, lit, udf

import uuid

# Read data from lake
df_Southridge = spark.read.load('abfss://movies@demosynapsedls01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/Southridge/CloudStreaming/dbo.Transactions.parquet',
                        format='parquet',
                        inferSchema=True,
                        header=True, 
                        ignoreLeadingWhiteSpace=True, 
                        ignoreTrailingWhiteSpace=True
                        )

# Display dataframe
#df_Southridge.printSchema
#display(df_Southridge.limit(100))

# Rename columns
df_SouthridgeModified = df_Southridge.withColumnRenamed("TransactionID", "SourceSystemTransactionID")

# Add columns
df_SouthridgeModified = (
    df_SouthridgeModified.withColumn("SourceSystemID", lit("1").cast(IntegerType()))
)

# Reorder colums
df_SouthridgeModified = df_SouthridgeModified.select(
    'SourceSystemID',
    'SourceSystemTransactionID',
    'CustomerID',
    'MovieID',
    'StreamStart',
    'StreamEnd',
    'CreatedDate',
    'UpdatedDate'
)

# Convert column types
df_SouthridgeModified = (
    df_SouthridgeModified.withColumn("SourceSystemID", col("SourceSystemID").cast(StringType()))
                           .withColumn("SourceSystemTransactionID", col("SourceSystemTransactionID").cast(StringType()))
                           .withColumn("CustomerID", col("CustomerID").cast(StringType()))
                           .withColumn("MovieID", col("MovieID").cast(StringType()))
                           .withColumn("StreamStart", col("StreamStart").cast(TimestampType()))
                           .withColumn("StreamEnd", col("StreamEnd").cast(TimestampType()))
                           .withColumn("CreatedDate", col("CreatedDate").cast(DateType()))
                           .withColumn("UpdatedDate", col("UpdatedDate").cast(DateType()))
)

# Display dataframe
#df_SouthridgeModified.printSchema
#display(df_SouthridgeModified.limit(100))

# Add columns
df_unioned_withID = df_unioned.withColumn("GlobalTransactionID", uuidUDF())

# Order columns
df_unioned_withID = df_unioned_withID.select(
    'SourceSystemID',
    'GlobalTransactionID',
    'SourceSystemTransactionID',
    'CustomerID',
    'MovieID',
    'StreamStart',
    'StreamEnd',
    'CreatedDate',
    'UpdatedDate'
)

# Display dataframe
#df_unioned_withID.printSchema()
